column4: just upgraded to natty, but i have no unity -- my desktop hasn't changed at all
try intalling it with sudo apt-get install unity
another option is ckeck if unity is activated on compiz settings
i don't appear to have a unity plugin in compiz. is there a package for that?
yeah, but is dependency with unity package, so if it's installed, the option must be on compiz settings
unity is installed, but searching for 'unity' in compizconfig returns no results
i couldn't find the package to fix that. If it can help, i have it under the Desktop section on compiz settings manager
maybe some package is missing. i'll give you a list of unity packages that i have installed, wait please
it seems that's not my only problem. my sources.list is for maverick even though i've never had maverick installed. i upgraded from lucid to natty
:S people recommend to update to next inmediate version.... would you like my sources.list?
tell me if it works for you ;)
also, try with "update-manager -d" on the terminal before. let's see if it offers you the possibility to update
it seems that update-manager is working. i'm gonna let it finish. ty for your help:)
